fme:Camps.fme:What: First camping trip with Pflo and Healy. Met two dudes from Jemez Pueblo who descended on our campsite. Boom!
First camping trip with Pflo and Healy. Plucked Stroh's beer from the stream.
Camping test with John's Toyota Tacoma. Rained a lot.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Janis, Dan, Mary Birkel, Scott, Cammie
fme:Camps.fme:What: Walked right past elk rack.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:What: First time I camped here.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:What: Boomed back from hot springs. Hung out under tarp while it rained. Drank a lot of booze.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:What: Played durak by the cliff.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:Who: Lisa, Ray, Gnet, Mich., Mar., Dac., PJ, Deb., Jazz

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:What: Forgot my rain coat before hiking to Seven Springs day use area.
Aborted attempt at a canoe trip.
Starting point for a day paddle after aborting the San Francisco River. Crappy camp spot.
Cold morning. Went uphill to get in the sun. Did a bushwhack hike.
Saw first montezuma quails and first yellow-eyed junco. Jazz's last camping trip.
Epic hike from Chiricahua Peak. Stayed at Portal Peak Lodge. Birding.
Spring Break. Boomin' and bushwhackin'. Snow at summit. Some rain. Last time for tennies. Pat in red tights. Dan snores and is banished. Scotch & hot chocolate.
Overnight camp.
Heard something growl! Pretty canyons.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - just north of the Baca
fme:Camps.fme:What: Great view into Valle San Antonio. Helicopter flying at night.
Gnet's last hurrah. Nice hike down Canones Creek.
Emerald green grass. Belligerent bull.
Clementine's first camping trip. Dr. Jesus.
Got poured on. Stampede! Got my ass kicked at cribbage even though I stole 20+ points one game.
Anniversary. First night's camping spot. Cool hike the next day with Juan E & Co. on Pueblo Mesa.
Anniversary. Second night's camp. Very nice spot.
Nice meadow.
Too many M&Ms. Rain on Saturday so only Gnet, PJ, and I stayed the second night. Sliding exit through the mud on Sunday.
Campsite a little burned. Sadie chases ball forever. Nice hike up the north fork of the Rio Quemado on Saturday. Bighorn sheep at the lake. Too many flies in camp!

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Gnet, Ray, Larry Layne, PJ, Dacman, Tim McGivern
fme:Camps.fme:What: Gnet's bachelor party. Larry's boomin' giggle fest. Ray does chain dance. Lots and lots of laughing.
Hiked into Dome Wilderness. Cicadas.
Drove over to Obsidian Ridge for a hike. Lots of thunder and lightning. Some rain.
McCrystal Creek Campground. Durak. The sputtering generator that would not die. Nice loop hike.
Stress with Karen; I couldn't do anything right. Scott herds buffalo. Very nice hike in the Valle Vidal proper.
Gnet fishes and falls in. Pflo and I hike; see mangy bighorn. Beaver pond.
Access Fund trail work.
Access Fund trail work. Rainy Sunday so everyone bailed. David and I did a short hike.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cammie, Alex, Cflo, et al.
fme:Camps.fme:What: Memorial Day weekend trip. Lots of people!

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Lisa, Pflo, Pattie, Larry, et al.
fme:Camps.fme:What: Memorial Day weekend trip. Cold and rainy at first. A ton of tanagers.
Trip to NM and a break from fieldwork. Big coyote. Saw the train.
Bright full moon. Taped the weekend for Gnet but he never got it.
Flat tire. Dhavan smokes and hikes and lags behind. Epic day getting car back onto dirt road in 100 degree heat. Burgers at the Owl Cafe.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Gila at Upper Black Canyon Campground
fme:Camps.fme:What: Aborted backpacking trip. Boomin' near camp. Beautiful fall colors.
Car camping and hiking. Battling bulls.
First camping trip with Patrick. Big plane escorted by fighter jets around midnight.
Throwin' hatchets.
Overnight stop before heading to Dark Canyon for me and Scott, the Grand Canyon for Ted and Jenny.
Overnight trip. Loop hike with Ted. A little rain. Jenny pregnant.
Camp spot before Manzano Crest traverse. 30 miles in one day.
Overnight. Stopped at El Morro and the wolf sanctuary beforehand.
Hiked to Heart Lake. Saw a cinnamon bear. Guy from Ohio group strapped with a .357.
Bushwhack up to the trail. Beautiful views. Pat and I hiked Lobo Peak via Manzanita and Italianos Canyons (near Taos) on Sunday.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cflo, John, Jan, Larry, Greg, Volker
fme:Camps.fme:What: First Salt River trip. Did the whole thing in an IK.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cflo, John, Jan, Tim, Jim
fme:Camps.fme:What: A great trip - high water, nice weather, beautiful flowers, and lots of animals. Sweet hike up Hess Canyon. Saw first gila monster. Hurt my hand so half in IK and half on Pat's raft.
First night's camping on our SE NM adventure. Hiked up Dog Canyon and had lunch at White Sands the next day.
Second and third night of our SE NM adventure are at Three Rivers Campground. Lisa's longest hike at 12 miles! She freaks a bit at the top but perseveres.
Met up with Ron and Cora on their honeymoon trip. Climbed at Isle Of You. Had to climb Jizneyland just for the name!

Hiked the Cochise Stronghold trail (aka the Stronghold Divide Trail) with Pat the first day. Saw a ringtail that night. Climbed Moby Dick with Pat and Chris on day two. A little climbing at Isle Of You on day three. Manzatillo!
First trip to Canyonlands.
Nice spot in campground. David drives Elephant Hill to Joint Trail. David and I get drunk on the slickrock.
Long weekend trip before SWUG conference in Telluride. Wrote a letter to my buds. Nobody responded.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Hamburger Rock area near Needles, Canyonlands
fme:Camps.fme:What: We started and ended our trip here.
Two nights camping here. Had the place all to ourselves. Drove Elephant Hill for the first time. Nice day hikes.

Backpacking trip. Soft, silent snow one day; in shorts and t-shirts the next. Boomin' in the Joint Trail at night with luminarias. Ray's first backpack; carries all the trash. Patrick breaks down in Cortez beforehand.
Major 4-wheelin' and great hikes. An oustanding trip.
Backpacking and car camping around the Paria. Camped on a ledge with a view. First trip to the Escalante.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: San Juan River - Mexican Hat to Clay Hills
fme:Camps.fme:What: A mellow float. Hot! A nice swimmer rapid one day.
Tried to start the trip here but got rained out. Finished it here instead. First time at Jack's.
Did a couple of hikes. Saw my first chuckwalla. Also heard/saw a Peregrine swoop after some swallows at Cathedral Wash and the river.
Camped here for the Buckskin Gulch hike. Bested by Mormon children. Ray does the chain dance.
Camped here for Bull Valley Gorge and Round Valley Draw hikes. Boomin' with the Sentinels and the demon hell spider. Snow the next morning so a hung over retreat. Breakfast at Denny's in Page.
First camp of this trip. Cold chicken under the trees.
Camped on the slickrock. Snow early one morning so we bailed to Fry Canyon camp.
Last camp on this trip. Saw a grey fox on a hike. Fire breathing whiskey. Pumping water from the cooler.
First trip to Dark Canyon. Hiked in and out via the Sundance Trail. Squirrels eat cream chese. Raven steals homemade breadstick.
Met up with Ted and Jenny after Dark Canyon. Stopped by cops beforehand. Tested David and I with the breathalyzer. Confiscate Patrick's flask. Scott plays it cool.

Base camp for hikes down Hole In The Rock Road: Peek-a-boo, Spooky, Davis Gulch. Sweet camp site - what a view! I get drunk and aggressive the first night. Sock David in the gut. Ben flips me when I attack. Lost my Ache pinky ring here.
Camped somewhere around here before and after Lil' Death Hollow backpack. Itchy skin from eczema.
First night's backpack camp. Patrick ferries our packs through one narrow. Hike a bit up the Escalante on day two.
Second night's backpack. Water like chocolate milk. We herd a cow a ways up Wolverine the next day 'cause it won't let us pass.
Camp near Buckskin Gulch on the way to the Escalante. Had to bail on Buckskin due to the cold and water in the canyon.
Climbing weekend.
Climbing. Three outings in the spring and summer of 2004.
Second trip to Hueco Tanks, sometime in the spring. Big rain storm the second night.
First trip to Hueco Tanks. Stayed at the rock ranch.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Gnet, Cora, Chris Carpenter, another Chris, Jazz
fme:Camps.fme:What: Climbing trip. Garnett fishes. Feel intimidated at first, warming up on 9s and leading my first 10s.

Rode the train and hiked to Chicago Basin from the Cascade stop due to a mudslide. Bagged our first 14ers - Eolus, Windom, and Sunlight. Don't give double-red blood cells before a trip like this! From Cascade, rode out on a flatbed in pouring rain.
Spring break trip to Copper Canyon. Camp near Creel part of the time, also backpack into the canyon. Stolen and returned coffee pot. Hook up with Karen. Pat has car troubles on the drive home.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Bahia de Loreto Parque Nacional - Baja, Mexico
fme:Camps.fme:What: Sea kayaking in the Sea of Cortez (Bahia de Loreto Parque Nacional). Sergio & Lala were our guides. Met great people. Beautiful scenery. Cool snorkeling.
First night's camp before descending into Dark Canyon. Seriously fun route finding! Juan E bails and meets us at Youngs Canyon the next day.
Second and third night's camps. Sweet spot. Nice swimming hole. Fun hike up Youngs; found a nearly intact desert bighorn sheep skeleton. Juan and Rosie hike to us in one day from the Sundance Trail!
Fourth and fifth night's camps. Fun hike down canyon. Great swimming too. Hike out the Sundance Trail in the rain. Cold beer at the truck thanks to Juan E.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Grand Canyon - Day 02 - 24 and One-Half Mile
fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan
Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan
Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan
Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan

Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan
Pflo, Cflo, Larry, M'Leah, Meg, John, Jan

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Island In The Sky District - Canyonlands N.P.
fme:Camps.fme:What: Checked out several overlooks, Upheaval Dome hike (found a camera), wind and snow.
Beautiful but lots of people! Windy.
Bart's 40th birthday camping shindig.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Mount Whitney - Day 1 - Sequoia Nat'l Park
fme:Camps.fme:What: Shangri-La but with mosquitos. Gorgeous!

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Mount Whitney - Day 2 and 3 - Sequoia Nat'l Park
fme:Camps.fme:What: Sky Blue Lake. Base camp for our hike to Mount Whitney.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Mount Whitney - Day 4 - Inyo Nat'l Forest
fme:Camps.fme:What: Last night's camp at Chicken Spring Lake. Slept like crap.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Jemez - above Rio San Antonio near Baca boundary
fme:Camps.fme:Who: Lisa, Deborah, Bart, and the doggies
fme:Camps.fme:What: Nice weather and mellow weekend. I hiked over to Rio Cebolla while the rest of the gang hung out down at the Rio San Antonio. Signs of increased use at the camp site.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Cflo, Wendy, John, Jan, Larry, et. al.
fme:Camps.fme:What: Nice water and weather. A sweet trip. (entire group: Pflo, Cflo, Wendy, John, Jan, Jaime, Larry, Jim, Steve, Tom, Rafer, Mike)

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, M'Leah, Bill, Larry, Doug, Dana, Scott
fme:Camps.fme:What: Epic. Water is 6.4 feet at put in. Flip Doug's raft in Murph's Hole and lose Pat's trying to corral it. Recover both. I bail. Everyone else flies out at Indian Creek.

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Snake River - Pittsburg Landing to Heller Bar
fme:Camps.fme:What: Mellow trip. Few rapids but whirlpools and boils due to high water. Epic 3 night story of the Middle Fork. Pflo, Larry, Curt, Scott, Dana, Trent, Sheila, Amy, Carlitta, Rick

Nice day run! Lots of long rapids - mostly 2s with a few 3s. Lots of birds too - esp. western tanagers, lewis's woodpeckers, western dippers. Cold and cloudy at first. Pflo, Larry, Curt, Scott, Dana, Carlitta, Rick
A dry summer - finally a place to camp! Birds calling at night. Rowdy partiers from Grants the second night.
Stayed at Four Jeffreys Campground. It was full with Labor Day weekend visitors.
Camped near a stream with cascades coming in from above. Great place to soak your feet!
Guy from the Netherlands gives me his hefty dinner leftovers. Yay for extra calories!
Saw massive rockslide from camp. Beatutiful meadow view. Slept on a giant slab under the stars.
High country lakeside camp. Happy birthday to me!
Last night's camp in the trees. A bit of light rain. Deer and fawn pay a visit.
Scrambling in West and Main forks of Bluejohn. Encounter a small rattlesnake. Incredible pictographs in Horseshoe. Didn't hear a single canyon wren.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Lisa, Bart, Deborah, and the doggies
fme:Camps.fme:What: Camped in pretty meadow with blooming irises. Windy. Day hike in San Pedro Parks. Dumb boy scout pulling cooler.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April

Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Grand Canyon - Day 07 - Ninety One Mile Creek
fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April

fme:Camps.fme:Where: Grand Canyon - Day 10 - Across From Deer Creek
fme:Camps.fme:Who: Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April

Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Pflo, Betsy, Cflo, Wendy, M'Leah, Larry, April
Juan E, Steve, Krista, Dwight, Nellie the dog
fme:Camps.fme:What: Saline Springs campground. Hot springs, shower, palm trees, and the cleanest bathroom ever. Largely maintained by campers (cool!). Windy night.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Juan E, Steve, Krista, Dwight, Nellie the dog
fme:Camps.fme:What: Camped along the gravel road. Not a very nice spot but a pretty view of the valley.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Juan E, Steve, Krista, Dwight, Nellie the dog
fme:Camps.fme:What: Stayed at Furnace Creek Ranch. Not really a camp spot but part of the trip so I'm including it.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Juan E, Steve, Krista, Dwight, Nellie the dog
fme:Camps.fme:What: Camped just outside Beatty, Nevada on a road to a mine. Crappy spot but cool graffiti in the derelict buildings. A bit of rain in the middle of the night.
Short trip. Two day hikes in the Needles. Camped in and near Hamburger Rock.

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Lisa, Bart, Deborah, Larry, Susie, John, and dogs
fme:Camps.fme:What: Sweet camp spot! Great views of landscape and wildlife. Day hike with Deborah and Larry. 4-wheel drive exit via Brazos Ridge and on to Cumbres.
Terrestrial reunion! Four hikes in as many days. Great fun hanging out with good friends.
Tons of animals (elk, coyotes, turkeys, rabbit, frogs, many birds, etc.). Saw my first crossbills. Heard a wolf howl 250 yards from camp! Down to 10 degrees at night. Brrr!
Didn't see or hear any wolves but found several tracks (wolf, coyote, bear, elk, turkey). Saw lots of birds, a bear, a couple coyotes, and plenty of cattle.
Steve and Michelle's climbing wedding. Three days of sport climbing. And a wedding! Great people, great fun.
A few days of hiking, including day long Slaughter Mesa jaunt thru meadows and open pine park forest with alternating sun and snow. Saw 5 pronhorn race across the mesa.
Lots of birds, some reptiles, and 37 Coues deer. Larry's buddy Dan joins us. Sunny Flat no. 4 (with elf owl). Return to Pine Park (partially burned). I forgot how awesome this place is!
Back at El Rito after a decade. Climb poorly, fearfully but still glad to be there. Jenny on-sights all but one route!
Leaner tree camp a few spots over from shit bucket camp. Crappy site among even crappier sites. Hike up to Heart Lake the next day. Wildflowers!
Decent camp after Heart Lake hike. Lots of birds. April tells crapping human horror stories from Yosemite. Funny! Hike a few miles on the Midnight Trail (81) the next day.
Went here after El Rito. Site #20. A couple the next site over invites me to dinner and then gets in spat. Meet April the next day for hike in Columbine Canyon. Wildflowers!
A couple nights of partying. Forget my Thermarest so I sleep on the ground the first night. A kind soul offers a cot the next night.
An overnight trip with the visiting Healys.
Camped at Gooseberry B - Island In The Sky, Canyonlands.
Camped at Hardscrabble A - Island In The Sky, Canyonlands. (Day 3 was in Green River.)
Camped at Flint Seep - The Maze, Canyonlands. (Day 3 was in Green River.)
Camped at Chimney Rock - The Maze, Canyonlands.
Camped at Cave Towers at the head of Mule Canyon, Cedar Mesa.
Fun weekend climbing with Michelle and Steve! Everybody else bails. Finally got some mojo back lead climbing.
Looking for wolves. No sightings but heard them howl every night. Did see javelina, elk, coyote, and birds including 5 eagles (4 golden, 1 bald) feeding on an elk. Very warm and dry!
First night of birding trip.
Last two nights of birding trip. Identified 60 species total, including my first red-faced warbler. Nice weather, met some interesting people, and saw a bobcat on the drive out!

fme:Camps.fme:Who: Steve, Michelle, Lawrence, Sara, and more!
fme:Camps.fme:What: Climbing weekend with good friends! Lawrence makes his return to real rock. I finally send the tricky dihedral Rocket Science (5.10).
